word_mean: 覆盖，镶盖：制作牙冠或桥体时的一层牙色物质，通常是瓷料或丙烯酸树脂，以直接熔合、粘固或机械固定的方法镶贴于表面

sentence.Network_en: The wood was cut into large sheets of veneer.
sentence.Network_cn: 木料被锯成大块的薄板。

sentence.Network_en: He was able to fool the world with his veneer of education.
sentence.Network_cn: 他打着受过良好教育的幌子到处欺瞒世人。

sentence.Network_en: Her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentence.Network_cn: 她那彬彬有礼的伪装开始露馅儿了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (earlier as fineer): from German furni(e)ren, from Old French fournir 'furnish'

encyclopedia.content: veneer是薄木的英文名称，(俗称：木皮,单板；以下统称薄木)及其贴面装饰业起步于上世纪50年代，经半个世纪的发展，已具备了相当的规模。特别是近二十年来，随着我国家具制造业及装饰装修行业的跳跃式增长，其发展更是突飞猛进，涌现了大量的业界行家。

entry.def: If you refer to the pleasant way that someone or something appears as a veneer, you are critical of them because you believe that their true, hidden nature is not good.

example.ex: He was able to fool the world with his veneer of education...
example.tran: 他打着受过良好教育的幌子到处欺瞒世人。

example.ex: His super-clean image gave a veneer of respectability to the new professional set-up.
example.tran: 他超级整洁的形象使其新设的专业骗局看起来很正规很体面。

entry.def: Veneer is a thin layer of wood or plastic which is used to improve the appearance of something.

example.ex: The wood was cut into large sheets of veneer...
example.tran: 木料被锯成大块的薄板。

example.ex: Only the finest timbers and veneers are used.
example.tran: 只用上好的木料和饰面板。

means.word_mean: 1. coating consisting of a thin layer of superior wood glued to a base of inferior wood
2. an ornamental coating to a building

auth_sentence.content: There remains a veneer badly chipped of comity.
auth_sentence.res_content: There remains a veneer badly chipped of comity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There remains a veneer badly chipped of comity.

auth_sentence.content: Inside the house, the furniture was vinyl and veneer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Inside the house, the furniture was vinyl and veneer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Inside the house, the furniture was vinyl and veneer.

auth_sentence.content: Don't be fooled by the austere veneer of this Spanish dowager.
auth_sentence.res_content: Don't be fooled by the austere veneer of this Spanish dowager.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Don't be fooled by the austere veneer of this Spanish dowager.

sentences.en: For the first time her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.cn: 她温文尔雅的外表第一次露出破绽。

sentences.en: He managed to acquire a thin veneer of knowledge to mask his real ignorance.
sentences.cn: 他设法装出有点知识的外表，用来掩饰自己的无知。

sentences.en: His veneer of politeness concealed a ruthless determination.
sentences.cn: 他彬彬有礼的伪装下隐藏着不择手段的狠心。
